verses.roman:
nyamantrayetāṁ dāśārham
ātithyena saha dvijaiḥ
maithilaḥ śrutadevaś ca
yugapat saṁhatāñjalī

synonyms: nyamantrayetām—they both invited; dāśārham—Kṛṣṇa, the descendant of Daśārha; ātithyena—to be their guest; saha—along with; dvijaiḥ—the brāhmaṇas; maithilaḥ—Bahulāśva; śrutadevaḥ—Śrutadeva; ca—and; yugapat—simultaneously; saṁhata—held firmly together; añjalī—whose palms.
translation: At exactly the same time, King Maithila and Śrutadeva each went forward with joined palms and invited the Lord of the Daśārhas to be his guest, along with the brāhmaṇa sages.
